caption:
Table 1: State-of-the-art loss functions have several hyperparameters (6.4 on avg.). aLRP Loss has 
only one for step-function approximation (Sec. 2.1). See Appendix B for descriptions of the required 
hyperparameters. FL: Focal Loss, CE: Cross Entropy, SL1: Smooth L1, H: Hinge Loss.
Table 2: Ablation analysis on COCO minival. For optimal LRP (oLRP), lower is better.

Table 3: SB does not require tuning and slightly outper-
forms constant weighting for both IoU types.

Table 4: SB is not affected signifi-
cantly by the initial weight in the first 
epoch (w r ) even for large values.

Table 6: Comparison with the SOTA detectors on COCO test-dev. S, ×1.66 implies that the image 
is rescaled such that its longer side cannot exceed 1.66 × S where S is the size of the shorter side. 
R:ResNet, X:ResNeXt, H:HourglassNet, D:DarkNet, De:DeNet. We use ResNeXt101 64x4d.
